EllipseArc

class pyrit.geometry.EllipseArc(start_point: Point, end_point: Point, center_point: Point, major_point: Point, physical_tag: Optional[int] = None)

Bases: Curve

Class representing an ellipse

Constructor of the class EllipseArc.

Parameters

  • start_point (Point) – Starting point of the ellipse arc.

  • end_point (Point) – Ending point of the ellipse arc.

  • center_point (Point) – Center point of the ellipse arc.

  • major_point (Point) – Major point of the ellipse arc.

  • physical_tag (int, optional) – Physical tag of the entity. The default is None.

Return type

None.

Methods

add_to_gmsh

Adds Ellipse Arc to GMSH.

remove

Remove the Curve from GMSH.

reset_tag

Sets its own tag and the tags of all contained entities to None.

rotate

Rotate the Curve.

translate

Translate the Curve.

Attributes

added

Give True if the entity has beed added to gmsh and False if not.

center_point

Get the center point of the ellipse arc.

dim

Get the dimension of the Curve.

end_point

Get the end point of the ellipse arc.

major_point

Get the major point of the ellipse arc.

num_points

Get the number of points that are part of the Curve.

physical_tag

points

Get the points of a curve.

reversed

After using this property, next time getting the (existing) tag, the tag is negative.

start_point

Get the start point of the ellipse arc.

tag

Get the tag.

property points

Get the points of a curve.

Returns

Tuple in which each element represents a point.

remove(recursive=True)

Remove the Curve from GMSH.

Parameters

recursive (bool, optional) – If True, all entities that define this entity are removed as well. Default is True

Return type

None.

reset_tag() → None

Sets its own tag and the tags of all contained entities to None.

Return type

None

property reversed

After using this property, next time getting the (existing) tag, the tag is negative.

rotate(angle_x: float, angle_y: float, angle_z: float, rotation_origin: Optional[ndarray] = None)

Rotate the Curve.

Note the order of the rotation: first rotate around x-axis, then rotate around y-axis, the rotate around z-axis.

Parameters

  • angle_x (float) – Rotation angle around x-axis in radian

  • angle_y (float) – Rotation angle around y-axis in radian

  • angle_z (float) – Rotation angle around z-axis in radian

  • rotation_origin (np.ndarray, optional) – The origin around which is rotated. By default (0,0,0) is taken

Return type

None.

property tag

Get the tag.

translate(dx: float, dy: float, dz: float)

Translate the Curve.

Parameters

  • dx (float) – Translation in x-direction

  • dy (float) – Translation in y-direction

  • dz (float) – Translation in z-direction

Return type

None.
